original_title: Sri Lanka’s shares edge down on new fuel suppliers
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka shares edged down in mid day, as Lanka IOC brings down the market as China’s Sinopec enters the Sri Lankan fuel industry, an analyst said.
The main All Share Price Index was down 0.16 percent or 18.30 points to 11,088.24, while S&P SL20 was down 0.34 percent or 11.14 points to 3,220.
Losers during mid day trade were Lanka IOC, Expolanka and John Keells Holdings.
The market has been seeing interest in the tourism industry as Sri Lanka fulfils 65% of July arrivals target in first 20 days. (Colombo/July24/2023)
